title: Bankers' bonuses: No cap under Labour, says Reeves
description: The shadow chancellor has told the BBC Labour would not reinstate a bankers' bonuses cap that was scrapped last year by the Conservative government. It comes as Ms Reeves set out Labour's plans to boost economic growth through the financial services sector.

title: Labour: We’ll ‘unashamedly champion’ financial services as party plots rulebook reform
description: Labour has unveiled sweeping plans to shake up financial regulation and boost the growth of the City today as shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves said when the “sector succeeds, we all succeed”. In new proposals for the UK’s financial services sector ...

title: Seven illnesses patients told NOT to see GP over and to go to pharmacist instead from today
description: Patients can now be treated for a host of common illnesses at their local pharmacy instead of waiting for a GP appointment in a new £645 million deal with NHS England

title: Executives from steel giant Tata to be questioned over Port Talbot plans
description: “We’re very pleased that there has been such strong support for our plan from the Labour benches, along with a firm commitment to £3 billion of investment in our steel industry over the next decade. “At this critical juncture, we need to see far ...

title: MPs call for action amid warning of 10,000 annual heatwave deaths
description: The Environmental Audit Committee said the Government is not moving quickly enough to prevent deaths caused by extreme temperatures.

title: Newspaper headlines: Robbie Williams's Port Vale bid and 'Rise of the cyborgs'
description: The paper also says the Labour Party has launched outreach efforts amid concerns it is losing support of normally loyal Muslim voters over its position on the Middle East. The Guardian leads with comments from health experts warning the state of the NHS ...

title: BT and Lloyds chiefs among new business advisers to Sunak
description: Allison Kirkby, who will become BT Group’s first female chief this week, will be named on Wednesday as one of 15 members of the prime minister’s 2024 business council, Sky News learns.

title: Rachel Reeves and Sadiq Khan tell City A.M. readers: ‘When you succeed, we all succeed’
description: Rachel Reeves and Sadiq Khan tell City A.M. that Labour will put the full weight of government behind the City and financial services

title: Next government should declare NHS a national emergency, experts warn
description: Leading doctors and NHS leaders say underinvestment, staff shortages and ageing population pose ‘existential threat’ to service

title: Welsh Parliament rejects calls for council tax rise referendums
description: The Welsh Parliament has rejected calls to force local authorities to hold a referendum on any council tax rise more

title: 50% Of Business Leaders Want Keir Starmer As Next Prime Minister
description: Corporate leaders have said that they would have more business confidence if the Labour Party win the next general election.

title: What is the legal definition of genocide?
description: According to the Genocide Convention, the definition of genocide is any of the following acts committed with intent to destroy, in whole or in part, a national, ethnical, racial or religious group. This includes: Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part

title: Hidden US Prison Workforce Linked To McDonalds, Aldi And Coca-Cola
description: A new AP investigation has tied US giants like McDonalds and Walmart to manual prison labour in Louisiana State Penitentiary.

title: JAMES CLEVERLY: Don't let Labour take us back to square one... Our points-based immigration system means we have the tools to control our borders
description: Our post-Brexit points-based immigration system means we have the tools to control our borders and decide who has the right to come here. We control who comes to the UK to work, study and visit.

title: Argentinian court overturns Milei’s labour rules in blow to his reform plans
description: An Argentine court on Tuesday overturned labour rules proposed by President Javier Milei that would make it easier to sack workers, in a new blow to the leader’s efforts to shake up regulations that he says have hampered the country’s struggling economy.

title: James Cleverly vows tough migration rules will halt shock population rise to 74million
description: EXCLUSIVE: Home Secretary writes for the Express after figures reveal population set to grow by the equivalent of Birmingham five times over by 2036.

title: Only The Over-70s Would Vote Tory, Poll Finds
description: “The Tories are now the most popular party only among the over-70s, 43% of whom back the party. This is down from 67% in 2019, however, with Labour being the main beneficiaries, having increased their vote share among the oldest Britons from 14% to 23%.

title: A civil defence force would make Britain 'most resilient nation on Earth', minister says
description: Labour peer Lord West of Spithead, a former first sea lord and chief of naval staff, told the upper chamber of Parliament: “45 years ago I did the study into whether women should serve at sea in the Royal Navy, and I said they should, and I think it has ...

title: Reform UK will be ready for general election, Tice says
description: Reform UK leader Richard Tice says his party will be ready for a general election and urged Labour to stand aside, as he claims he did for the Conservatives in 2019.
